intro: Samolus, commonly known as the water pepper or marsh woundwort, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Onagraceae. It consists of several species, most of which are herbaceous perennials native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. Samolus species are sometimes used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties.
